Article Title: Carmelo Anthony and La La Anthony are always ready to support their son Kiyan, this time for "The Throne"

Article Title: Derrick Henry: Derrick Henry sells his home for $1.6 million below asking price, signaling the end of his Cowboys dream
Article Text:
Baltimore Ravens Derrick Henry | Nathan Ray Seebeck-Imagn Images

Derrick Henry bought his Dallas home with hopes of playing for the Cowboys, but it never happened

Derrick Henry Ready to win in Baltimore w/ Lamar, NFL legacy, Alabama’s best & RB future |The Pivot

I knew once free agency started that I wanted to work something out [with the Ravens] if we could,

Even though I’m living in Dallas and Dallas being a perfect situation, as well, because we lived there, we ain’t got to move…”

“They ain’t holla at me at all,”

Dallas could have been a perfect fit, but now Henry is locked in with the Ravens

Baltimore Ravens ’ star running back Derrick Henry has officially sold his Dallas home, but it’s not just a routine real estate transaction—it’s a symbolic farewell to a long-standing dream. Henry, who was once rumored to be eyeing a future with the Dallas Cowboys , sold the property for $1.6 million, falling short of its original asking price. This move marks the final chapter in his connection to Dallas, a city he once hoped to call his permanent NFL home.Henry originally bought the luxurious 4,154-square-foot home in Inwood Park in 2022. Featuring 20-foot ceilings, floor-to-ceiling windows, marble floors, and hardwood flooring, the property was a high-end investment. The stunning residence offers four bedrooms, four bathrooms, and a spacious three-car garage. Designed for both comfort and style, it boasts a gourmet kitchen, a cozy fireplace, custom walk-in closets, and a lush turf backyard perfect for outdoor relaxation.He first listed it for $1.8 million in 2023 but later took it off the market before relisting it at $1.6 million with a different real estate agency.According to TMZ, the final sale amount has not been disclosed, but sources suggest it was close to the lowered asking price. The sale ends Henry’s residential ties to Dallas, a city he had considered home due to his girlfriend, Adrianna Rivas , having family in the area.While Henry’s Dallas residency was partly personal, it was also fueled by his football aspirations. The running back admitted onpodcast that he had wanted to play for the Cowboys.” Henry said. “Unfortunately for Henry, the Cowboys never approached him.he revealed, making it clear that the interest was one-sided.Many Cowboys fans were thrilled by the idea of Derrick Henry joining the team and teaming up with Dak Prescott. With his powerful running style and Dallas’ solid offensive line, Henry could have brought a whole new level of strength to the offense. His ability to break tackles and wear down defenses seemed like the perfect fit for a team looking to boost its rushing attack. But despite all the excitement and speculation, the Cowboys stuck to their usual cautious approach to building the roster. Instead of making a big move for Henry, they decided to stay the course—meaning the star running back never got the call.Now, he’s set to be a major difference-maker for the Ravens, strengthening their already powerful running game alongside his new teammates. With his size, speed, and experience, he adds another level of dominance to Baltimore’s offense, making them an even bigger threat. Meanwhile, Cowboys fans may be left wondering what could have been, regretting the missed chance to have him in their backfield. But for Ravens fans, this move is cause for celebration. Henry isn’t just switching teams—he’s fully embracing Baltimore’s Super Bowl dreams, bringing his unstoppable energy and determination to help them compete at the highest level.Also read - Cam Heyward says he "Stole" DK Metcalf from the Chargers, did he cross the line?
Article Summary: Derrick Henry sold his Dallas home for $1.6 million, falling short of its original asking price. Henry originally bought the luxurious 4,154-square-foot home in Inwood Park in 2022. With his size, speed, and experience, he adds another level of dominance to Baltimore’s offense.

Article Title: 'F**k off!': Hardik Pandya, Sai Kishore go from heated staredown to hug in GT vs MI

'No love lost with Hardik?'

Why an icon from Hindi heartland became Chennai’s superhero | #dhoni #ipl I Witness

A heated exchange occurred between Hardik Pandya and R Sai Kishore during the intense match between Gujarat Titans and Mumbai Indians on Saturday at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad. The incident took place in the second innings of the match, as MI chased 197 runs to win.The confrontation happened in the fifteenth over of Mumbai Indians' innings when Sai Kishore bowled a dot ball and gave Pandya a death stare. This provoked the Mumbai Indians captain, who responded by yelling out 'f*** off* and walked towards Sai Kishore.The situation escalated as both players engaged in a staredown at the centre of the pitch, requiring umpire intervention.However, they reconciled during the post-match handshake, sharing a hug and laughing off the incident.After the IPL match, commentator Ian Bishop interviewed Sai Kishore and asked, "No love lost with Hardik?"The spinner replied, "He’s a good friend of mine, inside the field it should be like that. Inside the field, anybody is an opponent, but we don’t take things personally.""We are good competitors. That's how I think the game should be," he added.Sai Kishore delivered a solid performance, taking 1 wicket for 37 runs in his four-over spell, including the important dismissal of Tilak Varma.Pandya had mixed fortunes in the match, performing well with the ball by taking two wickets for 29 runs but struggling with the bat, scoring only 11 runs from 17 balls. His dismissal by Rabada in the 17th over effectively ended Mumbai's chances.In the process, Mumbai Indians suffered their second consecutive loss of the season, failing to chase down the target of 197 runs. They managed to score 160/6 in their allotted 20 overs.Gujarat's bowling attack proved effective, with Prasidh Krishna (2/18) and Mohammed Siraj (2/34) leading the charge. Siraj removed both openers, Rohit Sharma and Ryan Rickelton, during the powerplay.Krishna made crucial breakthroughs by dismissing Suryakumar Yadav (48) and Tilak Varma (39) in the middle overs, helping Gujarat secure a 36-run victory.

Article Title: Travis Kelce and Jason Kelce couldn’t stop laughing at Jayson Tatum’s honest reaction to his nickname ‘The Anomaly’
Article Text:
Jayson Tatum and Travis Kelce. Image via: Mitchell Leff/ Getty Images | New Heights Podcast (screengrab)

Jayson Tatum reacted to his nickname ‘The Anomaly’ while speaking with Travis Kelce and Jason Kelce



Where did Jayson Tatum’s nickname come from?



Boston Celtics star Jayson Tatum ’s reaction to a particular nickname has sparked plenty of discussion among fans and media alike. Tatum, who has been a star player for the Celtics, recently addressed the growing trend of people calling him ‘ The Anomaly ’ during his chat with NFL star siblings Travis Kelce and Jason Kelce in a new episode a their New Heights podcast .During a guest appearance on the New Heights podcast hosted by NFL stars Travis and Jason Kelce, Jayson Tatum was asked about the nickname that has been making rounds on social media. Travis Kelce, referring to Tatum’s Wikipedia page, brought up the moniker and asked, “Has anybody that is close to you ever actually called you, ‘The Anomaly’?”Tatum was amused. He responded with a candid answer that sent the Kelce brothers into fits of laughter. “Twitter is not a real place, I’ll say that,” Tatum hared. His reaction made it clear that he wasn’t exactly embracing the nickname, despite its growing popularity.Jason Kelce, however, had a different take. “I would run with that one. I like it. ‘The Anomaly’ is a good one. I don’t know who came up with that.” To which Travis Kelce agreed, saying, “It is a banger.”The origins of ‘The Anomaly’ trace back to social media, where an X user first suggested it, pointing out Tatum’s unique skill set. “Handles like someone 6 inches shorter, shoots pull-ups like a guard, finishes at the rim like a center, and consistently defends 1-5.”The nickname got wide attention, and soon, even official team accounts like the Portland Trail Blazers started using it in their game promotions. Basketball Reference has even added it to Tatum’s list of nicknames.Previously, when asked directly if he liked the name, he hesitated before admitting, “Ahhh, I don’t know.” He went on to mention that friends and teammates call him by other names, such as ‘Big Deuce’ and ‘Taco.’Also Read: Jayson Tatum's injury report (March 26, 2025): Is the Boston Celtics star fit to play against the Phoenix Suns tonight? Regardless of whether ‘The Anomaly’ nickname sticks, there’s no denying that Tatum’s game lives up to the title. At 6’10”, his mobility, ball-handling, and scoring ability make him one of the most versatile players in the NBA. He has been a standout star for the Celtics and is arguably one of the most complete players in the league today.
Article Summary: Boston Celtics star Jayson Tatum was a guest on the New Heights podcast. He was asked about his nickname 'The Anomaly' and his reaction. Tatum responded by saying, "Twitter is not a real place, I’ll say that"

Article Title: Who won yesterday's IPL match, CSK vs RCB: Yesterday IPL match result
Article Text:
CSK vs RCB (BCCI Photo)

NEW DELHI: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) ended a 17-year winless streak at Chepauk with a dominant 50-run victory over Chennai Super Kings (CSK) in Friday's IPL match. RCB posted a competitive 196/7, with Rajat Patidar leading the charge with a fortuitous 51 runs off 32 balls, supported by Tim David’s late blitz (22* off 8 balls).Despite early fireworks from Phil Salt (32 off 16 balls) and Devdutt Padikkal (27 off 14 balls), RCB struggled in the middle overs, but Patidar’s knock and David’s late hitting propelled them to a solid total.CSK’s chase never gained momentum as they crumbled to 146/8, with key wickets falling early. Josh Hazlewood was the standout performer with the ball, claiming 3/21, including the vital scalps of Rahul Tripathi and Ruturaj Gaikwad, reducing CSK to 8/3 within the first two overs.Bhuvneshwar Kumar (1/20) also contributed, dismissing Deepak Hooda.Though Rachin Ravindra (41 off 31 balls) and Sam Curran (8) tried to stabilize, the required run rate surged, and wickets fell at regular intervals. Curran was dismissed by Liam Livingstone, and Ravindra was bowled out by Yash Dayal (2/18), who also removed Shivam Dube (19).CSK’s decision to send Ravichandran Ashwin instead of MS Dhoni at this stage signaled their lack of fight. Dhoni’s 30* off 16 balls, including 2 sixes, was a mere consolation.RCB’s bowlers, including Livingstone and Dayal, tightened the screws, and an outstanding performance from Impact Sub Suyash Sharma (4-0-32-0) kept CSK under control.Patidar’s fortunate fifty and Hazlewood's destructive spell were key to RCB’s historic win, marking a rare defeat for CSK at home and a memorable victory for RCB.
Article Summary: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) ended a 17-year winless streak at Chepauk with a dominant 50-run victory over Chennai Super Kings (CSK) RCB posted a competitive 196/7, with Rajat Patidar leading the charge with a fortuitous 51 runs off 32 balls, supported by Tim David’s late blitz. Josh Hazlewood was the standout performer with the ball, claiming 3/21, including the vital scalps of Rahul Tripathi and Ruturaj Gaikwad.

NEW DELHI: New Zealand's 21-year-old right-hand batter Muhammad Abbas made history on Saturday, smashing the fastest-ever fifty on ODI debut during the first match of the three-match series against Pakistan at McLean Park in Napier.The Lahore-born cricketer reached his half-century in just 24 balls, breaking the previous record held by India's Krunal Pandya, who achieved the feat in 26 balls against England in 2021.Abbas displayed remarkable intent, finishing his innings with 52 off 26 balls at an explosive strike rate of 200. His knock featured three fours and three sixes, providing New Zealand with the late fireworks in the match.Following his record-breaking innings, Abbas described his debut as "special" and credited Mark Chapman — who played a match-winning 132 off 111 balls — for his support at the crease."This is special. Can't describe the feeling now. Special to contribute, and Chappy was unbelievable. To get in there and show what I can do is special to me and my family. They're sitting in the crowd, so it’s quite special for them as well," Abbas said after the match.He also revealed the backing he received from New Zealand coach Gary Stead, saying, "Gary told me to go out there and do what I do best. That was the license I needed."Mark Chapman’s century and right-arm seamer Nathan Smith’s four-wicket haul powered New Zealand to a convincing 73-run victory over Pakistan in the series opener.With this win, the Blackcaps take a 1-0 lead, with the second match set to be played in Hamilton on Wednesday and the final match scheduled for Saturday at Mount Maunganui.

Article Title: Paige Bueckers’ stellar performance: Why she’s not getting the same spotlight as Caitlin Clark
Article Text:
Images via Joe Buglewicz/Getty Images

Paige Bueckers’ return to dominance: Why her hype is missing

Caitlin Clark vs. Paige Bueckers: Their two March Madness battles, relived

Paige Bueckers addresses media bias and the price of speaking out

The Guardian

Paige Bueckers deserves more recognition for her remarkable comeback

Paige Bueckers has been one of the most electrifying talents in college basketball for years. As a standout for the UConn Huskies and a projected No. 1 pick in the upcoming WNBA draft, her skill set speaks for itself. Yet, Bueckers’ impact reaches far beyond her on-court prowess. She has leveraged her platform to advocate for meaningful change in the sport, emphasizing the need to uplift all players rather than focusing solely on individual stardom. For her, leadership is not only about winning games but shaping the future of women’s basketball. Paige Bueckers has always been aware of the power of attention in sports. She recognizes that individual stardom can only go so far in growing the game and has long advocated for a more inclusive spotlight.“Everybody was focused on me my freshman year,” Bueckers said during the NCAA Tournament. “But it’s more important to grow the game by sharing the spotlight... and showing all the stars of college basketball.”Even with that mindset, her return to dominance has been impossible to ignore. But here’s the thing—her name isn’t everywhere like it used to be. The question is, why?Bueckers’ journey hasn’t been easy. A torn ACL in 2022 wiped out an entire season, adding to earlier injury struggles. People questioned if she’d ever be the same player again.She didn’t just return—she came back better. She’s the only player across the NBA, WNBA, and college basketball with a 50/40/90 shooting split this season. She’s putting up nearly 20 points a game, leading the conference in assists, and making UConn a serious title contender. And yet, despite all that, she’s not generating the same media frenzy Caitlin Clark did last year.While Bueckers’ performance has been remarkable, a deeper look into her media coverage reveals why her stellar comeback hasn’t garnered the attention it deserves. Bueckers has never been afraid to speak out, and that might explain some of it. When she won College Athlete of the Year at the 2021 ESPYs, Bueckers used her platform to address the underrepresentation of Black women in sports.“With the light that I have now as a white woman leading a Black-led sport, I want to shed light on Black women,” she said. “They don’t get the media coverage they deserve. Their value is undeniable.”She wasn’t wrong. Black athletes have long dominated the WNBA’s biggest awards but don’t always get the same mainstream attention. Bueckers named Maria Taylor, Robin Roberts , Maya Moore, and others, calling for a shift in how Black women in sports are covered.It was a bold move—and one that may have changed how certain audiences viewed her. Former NBA player Etan Thomas put it bluntly in: “While Black America cheered Bueckers, mainstream white America—a demographic that once saw her as a ‘media darling’—wasn’t as loud about her anymore.”Race and media narratives have always shaped sports. The 2023 NCAA Championship was a perfect example—Angel Reese was criticized for her confidence, while Caitlin Clark was celebrated for the same fire. It’s a pattern that’s been around forever, but women’s basketball is just now seeing it play out on a bigger stage.Unlike Clark, Bueckers isn’t part of a rivalry that fuels constant headlines. She’s just an elite player who also happens to challenge the status quo. And in a world where athletes are often rewarded for staying quiet, maybe that’s why her comeback isn’t being celebrated the way it should be.Still, Bueckers keeps doing what she does. She’s a leader on and off the court, supporting teammates like Jana El-Alfy during Ramadan and finding peace in gospel music before games. She doesn’t need the validation—she knows exactly who she is.UConn is making a push for another title, and Bueckers is at the center of it. Whether or not the media gives her the attention she deserves, her impact is clear. If she wins big but doesn’t get the same headlines, we’ll all know why.Also Read: She will be back stronger and better: USC Trojan star JuJu Watkins suffers season-ending injury as NBA and WNBA stars, such as Magic Johnson, Caitlin Clark, and more, show support Regardless of whether the media catches up to her impact, Bueckers continues to redefine leadership in sports. She’s a force on and off the court—championing inclusivity, diversity, and the true spirit of competition. UConn’s title hopes rest on her shoulders, and no matter how much attention she gets, Paige Bueckers’ influence is undeniable.
Article Summary: Paige Bueckers has been one of the most electrifying talents in college basketball for years. A torn ACL in 2022 wiped out an entire season, adding to earlier injury struggles. She’s putting up nearly 20 points a game, leading the conference in assists and making UConn a serious title contender.

Article Title: IPL 2025: The curious case of MS Dhoni at No. 9
Article Text:
MS Dhoni came down to bat at No. 9 during Chennai Super Kings' loss against Royal Challengers Bengaluru in Chennai.

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

Why an icon from Hindi heartland became Chennai’s superhero | #dhoni #ipl I Witness

CSK in IPL 2025: Sixth title loading for Chennai Super Kings?

Chennai: There’s a new ‘No. 9’ in town. MS Dhoni has made a career out of being out of the box, but on Friday night at the MA Chidambaram Stadium, he seemed to be stretching things a bit too far.As wickets fell and CSK kept losing steam in their chase of 197, the fans got more and more impatient. They wanted to see their ‘Thala’ come out and take on the RCB bowlers, but the wait continued. It was only after Ravichandran Ashwin, not exactly a swashbuckler, got out in the 16th over that Dhoni walked in at No. 9, probably the lowest that he has batted in his 18-year IPL career.Not that he batted badly. The 16-ball 30* was an indicator that his ability to clear the boundary hasn’t exactly diminished. In fact, it was his late burst of 19 off Krunal Pandya that brought down the margin of defeat to 50. But then, what’s holding him back? Dhoni is apparently “fitter than what he was in the last two years,” when he was playing with a knee injury and a muscle tear, respectively. His wicketkeeping skills are only getting better — the stumping of Phil Salt on Friday was a piece of beauty — but there’s a strange reluctance to go up the order with the bat.Virender Sehwag was quite critical about his decision to bat No. 9. “What can you do? Even when he was playing for India, he didn’t care much for suggestions to go up the order. Now, it’s probably the fag end of his career, what can you expect?” Sehwag said in a post-match show.The CSK think-tank, though, has a different take on the issue. Captain Ruturaj Gaikwad was asked before the first game against Mumbai Indians if there will be a case for a promotion in the batting order for Dhoni. “MSD has been performing a specific role and he is doing that very well. It’s unlikely to change,” he said.What he meant was that Dhoni is still immensely dangerous at the business end of the innings, where his ability to clear the fence and the fear factor that he generates combine beautifully to bolster the CSK totals. Last year, in those short bursts, Dhoni was batting at a strike-rate of 220.54, and the CSK team wants that same impact this time too.Even though the legend has maintained his body well, there’s always that gnawing suspicion that too much running between the wickets may just lead to damage of the ageing body that has taken a lot of wear and tear. The IPL is a two-month journey, and the team wants him fully fit when things really get tight at the back-end.Don’t be surprised if CSK are only three down in the 15th over against Rajasthan Royals in Guwahati on Sunday and Dhoni comes out to bat. “Dhoni has done a good pre-season, working on his hitting and keeping skills,” coach Stephen Fleming said.
Article Summary: MS Dhoni came down to bat at No. 9 during Chennai Super Kings' loss against Royal Challengers Bengaluru in Chennai. It was probably the lowest that he has batted in his 18-year IPL career. The 16-ball 30* was an indicator that his ability to clear the boundary hasn’t exactly diminished.

Article Title: Who won yesterday's IPL match, SRH vs LSG: Yesterday IPL match result

NEW DELHI: In a thrilling IPL encounter, Shardul Thakur 's impressive four-wicket haul and Nicholas Pooran 's sensational display of power-hitting guided Lucknow Super Giants ( LSG ) to a five-wicket victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) on Thursday.Thakur's dream comeback continued as he returned with figures of 4/34, helping LSG restrict the formidable SRH batting lineup to 190/9.Pooran then took center stage, showcasing his 360-degree hitting prowess with a blistering 70 off just 26 deliveries, including six fours and six maximums. His partnership with Mitchell Marsh (52 off 31) yielded a match-winning 116 runs for the second wicket, propelling LSG to chase down the target in just 16.1 overs.Despite losing Aiden Markram early in their chase, LSG surged ahead thanks to the effortless hitting from Marsh and Pooran. Pooran, in particular, was at his attacking best, dealing primarily in sixes and clobbering Simarjeet and Abhishek Sharma for massive hits, mostly towards the square boundary.SRH found it challenging to contain Pooran as he didn't even spare Cummins, hitting him for two fours in his first over to reach 77/1 in the powerplay. Pooran brought up the fastest fifty of the season in just 18 balls with another colossal six over square leg off Adam Zampa's bowling.Cummins eventually trapped Pooran in front of the wickets in the ninth over, but Marsh took the onus upon himself and brought up his half-century off just 29 balls. Although LSG skipper Rishabh Pant (15 off 15) couldn't contribute much, Abdul Samad played an entertaining cameo to guide his side home.Earlier, after opting to bowl first, Shardul (4/34) provided LSG with a fiery start, removing Abishek Sharma and the previous match's centurion, Ishan Kishan, in consecutive balls in the third over. While Shardul sent Sharma packing with a short delivery, he dismissed Kishan caught behind off an innocuous delivery down the leg side.Travis Head (47 off 28), however, looked in ominous form as he took the attack to the opposition, using his brute power to deal in boundaries and sixes. Head was particularly brutal against Avesh Khan, hitting him for two sixes and one four to pick up 18 runs in the fourth over.Head was fortunate to receive two reprieves, but his luck eventually ran out when fast bowler Prince Yadav disturbed his timbers to claim his first IPL wicket.Henrich Klaasen (26 off 17) was run out in a bizarre fashion by Yadav off his own bowling, while young Aniket Verma played a 13-ball 36-run cameo that included five sixes before falling to leg-spinner Disvesh Rathi.SRH skipper Pat Cummins (18 off 4) hit three sixes off his first three balls before departing in style, contributing to SRH's competitive total of 190/9.
Article Summary: Lucknow Super Giants ( LSG) beat Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) by five wickets. Shardul Thakur (4/34) and Nicholas Pooran (70) guided LSG to victory. LSG chased down the target of 190 in 16.1 overs.

After serving a one-match suspension for an over-rate offence from Mumbai Indians ' (MI) concluding match of the 2024 Indian Premier League season, Hardik Pandya will be back to lead the five-time champions in their second match of this edition against Gujarat Titans in Ahmedabad on Saturday.Both MI and the 2022 champions Gujarat had lost their opening fixtures against Chennai Super Kings and Punjab Kings, respectively and are keen to put a win on the board for their first points.The MI squad utilised the extended break between their first and second matches by spending time at the Reliance facility in Jamnagar, where they participated in team-building exercises and relaxation activities.While the return of captain and all-rounder Hardik will come as a boost for MI, they will remain without the services of their premier fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah, who continues to recuperate from his back injury at the BCCI's Centre of Excellence on Bengaluru.Hardik's return to the playing eleven likely means Robin Minz's exclusion, although MI's batting performance on the tricky Chepauk pitch failed to generate confidence.The batting conditions in Ahmedabad on Saturday evening will prove more favourable, considering the substantial 475 runs scored in 40 overs during the first match of the season at the venue between Punjab Kings (243) and hosts Gujarat (232).But the batting-friendly surface at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad raises concerns about Mohammed Siraj's effectiveness, following his expensive spell of 54 runs in the previous match where Punjab batters dominated his bowling.With not many senior Indian pacers in the GT ranks, it will be a strategic call that home team head coach Ashish Nehra will fret upon. The pressure to contain runs as well as take wickets is way too much on Kagiso Rabada and Rashid Khan.Both the teams clearly had difficulties in finding the optimal blend of their overseas players.For MI, the challenges are further intensified due to Suryakumar Yadav's prolonged dip in performance over the past year, while Rohit Sharma also needs to rediscover his consistency.The addition of Pandya strengthens the batting lineup while offering bowling options, particularly at the start of the innings. His expertise in delivering wide yorkers during death overs.The Gujarat Titans' overall performance this season could heavily depend on captain Shubman Gill's batting form.The bowling department presents concerns for captain Gill, as the Indian pacers - Siraj, Prasidh Krishna and Ishant Sharma - predominantly employ similar hit-the-deck techniques. Apart from Rabada, the pace attack lacks variety in their bowling arsenal.
Article Summary: Hardik Pandya will lead Mumbai Indians against Gujarat Titans on Saturday. Pandya served a one-match suspension for an over-rate offence. MI and the 2022 champions Gujarat had lost their opening fixtures against Chennai Super Kings and Punjab Kings, respectively.

NEW DELHI: World under-23 champion Reetika Hooda relinquished a substantial advantage in the final against Kyrgyzstan’s Aiperi Medet Kyzy to settle for a silver medal in the Asian wrestling championships in Amman, Jordan.Reetika looked poised for a convincing victory leading 6-2 in her women’s freestyle 76kg championship match against Aiperi, but yielded four points in the final 10 seconds and finished second. The Kyrgyz opponent had defeated the Indian in the quarterfinals of the Paris Olympics last year.Earlier, Reetika had defeated South Korean Seoyeon Jeong 3-0 in the quarters and then accounted for Japan’s Nodoka Yamamoto by a 10-0 scoreline, securing a victory by fall in the semis.Her teammates, Mansi Lather and Muskan , added to the country’s medal tally by winning a bronze each.Mansi secured her first senior international medal after winning bronze in the 68kg division, following her triumph over Kazakhstan’s Irina Kazyulina 12-2 via technical superiority.Mansi, a World under-17 champion, was awarded a victory by forfeit in her quarters when world 72kg champion and tournament favourite, Japan’s Ami Ishii, withdrew due to an injury.Muskan (59kg) comfortably defeated Philippines’ Arian G Carpio in her qualification bout but lost her quarterfinal to Japan’s Sakura Onishi. Up against Mongolia’s Altjin Togtokh in the bronze playoff, Muskan gradually got a grip over the contest by sealing it 4-0.Earlier, India concluded its campaign in the Greco-Roman division with two medals. Nitesh won the bronze on Thursday, following Sunil Kumar’s third-place finish in the continental meet. It was Nitesh’s first senior medal at the Asian level.
Article Summary: World under-23 champion Reetika Hooda relinquished a substantial advantage in the final against Kyrgyzstan’s Aiperi Medet Kyzy to settle for a silver medal in the Asian wrestling championships in Amman, Jordan. Her teammates Mansi Lather and Muskan added to the country's medal tally by winning a bronze each. Earlier, India concluded its campaign in the Greco-Roman division with two medals.

Article Title: 'Where is the 600-700 run season?': IPL experts question Rohit Sharma after another poor start
Article Text:
Mumbai Indians' Rohit Sharma looks on after being bowled by Mohammed Siraj against Gujarat Titans in IPL 2025. (PTI)

Former India players Manoj Tiwary and Virender Sehwag have raised concerns about Mumbai Indians' Rohit Sharma 's recent performance following another single-digit score. Mumbai Indians faced a 36-run defeat against Gujarat Titans, marking their second consecutive loss in IPL 2025.Rohit Sharma's IPL journey has been challenging lately. He was dismissed for a duck by Khaleel Ahmed in the opening match against CSK.Against Gujarat Titans, Rohit managed to hit two boundaries in the first three balls. However, Mohammed Siraj's precise delivery that swung back in dismissed him shortly after.In the past five IPL seasons, Rohit has crossed the 400-run mark only once. The Mumbaikar has had six single-digit scores in last nine IPL innings.Tiwary expressed concern about Rohit's inability to consistently achieve 600-700 runs per season.The situation is particularly notable following last year's controversial captaincy change. Hardik Pandya's appointment as captain in place of Rohit Sharma led to widespread fan disapproval, with crowds booing Pandya at various venues."Look, I'm telling you, I don't want to be tough, but I must be. For some players, you have to be. Look, it's high time Rohit Sharma got back among the runs. The ability of a player like Rohit Sharma is not 400. Last season, he scored 400, he hit a century, that's fine. But where is the 800-900 season? Rohit is just not able to have these types of seasons. Why does Virat Kohli always score? You tell me. It's equally good. It's equally good, but there should be a season where Rohit scores 600-700," Manoj Tiwary told Cricbuzz."He should take his orange cap with him. That's how it should be. How will it be if you don't get a good start? I expect a lot from him. That's why he was retained. Because of last year's drama and controversy, it felt like Rohit would leave because there were a lot of small audio clips. Despite that, he was retained. But since there were no runs in the last two matches, the atmosphere must have been mixed up," he added.Former India opener Sehwag also shared his thoughts on Rohit's performance. While acknowledging his admiration for Rohit, Sehwag suggested it might be too late to expect a 600-700 run season from him."What Manoj Tiwary said about Rohit Sharma, where is that season? Isn't it too late for this type of season to come (laughs)? We are also his fans, but we are just asking where the season of 600-700 runs is. When has Rohit Sharma done that? It has been 18 years, when it has not happened in 18 years, how can you hope for this to happen now when he is at the last part of his career?" asked Sehwag.Following their loss to Gujarat Titans, Mumbai Indians now stand at ninth position in the points table. Their next match is scheduled against the defending champions Kolkata Knight Riders at the Wankhede Stadium on Monday.
Article Summary: Rohit Sharma has had six single-digit scores in last nine IPL innings. Former India players Manoj Tiwary and Virender Sehwag have raised concerns about his recent performance. Mumbai Indians faced a 36-run defeat against Gujarat Titans, their second consecutive loss in IPL 2025.
